thread.title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger glum as Chelsea fans celebrate | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger glum as Chelsea fans celebrate | Daily Mail Online

author: Andy Warren For Mailonline
title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger glum as Chelsea fans celebrate | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Wenger's arrival in the stands before kick-off saw the Frenchman receive plenty of attention, but that was nothing compared to what he received after Marcos Alonso headed the hosts into an early lead. The Spanish full-back beat Hector Bellerin to an aerial challenge, after Diego Costa's header had come back off the bar, with Alonso thumping his effort into the back of the net and leaving the Arsenal player flat on the turf. While the Chelsea fans went wild, Wenger looked glum as fans sat around began taking pictures with mobile phones and iPads, capturing the moment Arsenal went behind. Wenger was shown to his seat by members of the Chelsea staff prior to the game kicking off Gabriel was then unable to make the most of a clear headed chance, which forced Thibaut Courtois into a stunning save, as Wenger's afternoon became more and more tough. Wenger was shown to his seat by members of the Chelsea staff prior to kick-off and had members of his own backroom team sat around him, including first team coach Boro Primorac. He made his exit after 44 minutes, as he headed to the dressing room to give his half-time team talk with his side a goal down at the break. RELATED ARTICLES
